title: How to check proprietary firmware for GPL violation
content:
I have a proprietary binary (firmware), and I'd like to check whether it contains opensource components. I'm thinking about extracting what it contains - probably binaries - and use 
strings
, 
grep
and a couple of automated github/bitbucket/etc. searches to identify potential GPL violations. I know this approach is very limited, that's why I'm looking for advices and/or existing tools that could be relevant?

answers_data.content:
Use binwalk.

The ability to analyze a firmware image and extract data from it is extremely useful. It can allow you to analyze an embedded device for bugs, vulnerabilities, or GPL violations without ever having access to the device. (http://www.devttys0.com/2011/05/reverse-engineering-firmware-linksys-wag120n/)
